Title: 2 Mechanical and 1 Software e Automação Engineers
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Estamos a recrutar para o Núcleo de R&D+i :

Engenheiro Software e Automação (M/F)

 

Funções:

  • Levantamento de requisitos e definição da arquitetura da solução;
  • Desenvolvimento de firmware de controlo para sistemas embebidos;
  • Desenvolvimento de sistemas de supervisão e controlo;
  • Desenvolvimento de software para integração de sistemas;
  • Desenvolvimento e produção protótipos e demonstradores.

Requisitos:

  • Licenciatura/Mestrado em Engenharia Eletrotécnica, Informática ou equivalente;
  • Fluência na língua inglesa;
  • Criatividade, inovação e imaginação;
  • Capacidade de trabalho em equipas multidisciplinares;
  • Fortes conhecimentos de programação (C/C++, java, python, …);
  • Experiência com APIs de comunicação M2M (MQTT, JSON, OPC UA, …);
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento web (html, php, javascript, …);
  • Flexibilidade, foco, organização e orientação por objetivos;
  • Fortes competências de apresentação verbal e visual;
  • Proatividade, autonomia e empreendedorismo.

Valoriza-se:

  • Disponibilidade Imediata;
  • Competências de desenho CAD 2D/3D;
  • Experiência na programação de sistemas embebidos ( AVR, ESPRESSIF, …)
  • Experiência com infraestruturas cloud distribuídas de monitorização e controlo;
  • Experiência com boas práticas de ciber-segurança e/ou pentesting;
  • Experiência no desenvolvimento de soluções de visão artificial;
  • Experiência no desenvolvimento de soluções de inteligência artificial;
  • Experiência em funções similares.

Se partilha dos mesmos interesses, envie-nos a sua candidatura até dia 15 de setembro de 2024, com a referência R&D Soft-CPVH-C|24 no assunto do e-mail, para:

rh@matglow.com

Engenheiro Mecânico (Fluidos e Calor) (M/F)

  • Desenho 3D cad de circuitos de fluidos;
  • Efetuar dimensionamento de circuitos termodinâmicos;
  • Efetuar simulação computacional de termodinâmica;
  • Adaptar os produtos aos processos de fabrico e vice-versa;
  • Elaborar fichas técnicas e orçamentação;

  • Capacidade de trabalho em equipas multidisciplinares;
  • Familiarização com os processo e ferramentas de fabrico;
  • Flexibilidade, foco, organização e orientação por objetivos;
  • Fortes competências de apresentação verbal e visual;
  • Proatividade, autonomia e empreendedorismo;

  • Disponibilidade Imediata;
  • Experiência em processos produtivos;
  • Experiência em funções similares;
  • Experiência com Solidworks e Solidworks Simulation;
  • Experiência com Comsol, Ansys, Abacus…

Title: Volkswagen Digital Solutions - Site Reliability Engineer
Description:
Volkswagen Digital Solutions is currently hiring a Site Reliability Engineer developer to join their amazing team

About The Company

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) they are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. They make sure that their products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Their main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management. 🚗

About The Role

You will be working in a DevOps Team and will be responsible for configuration, deployment, monitoring, and application availability.

In this role, you should be able to automate tasks, treat the infrastructure as code, and take corrective actions to solve operations issues. You should also have a mindset to continuously improve, be proactive and participative with the team ceremonies, be a team player and enjoy sharing knowledge.

You'll be focused in


Analyzing, testing and technically investigating all reported problems and outages;
Automate tasks;
Taking initiative and ownership of problems to solve them;
Managing, escalating, and controlling incidents with clients until closure;
Participating in the definition and analysis of requirements;
Collaborating with internal teams;
Automate infrastructure in the cloud;
Configuring and providing observability for the application;
Actively working in conjunction with the developer team to guide and help them;


To succeed, you'll need


Experience with Cloud Environments
Experience with Kubernetes, CI/CD, Virtual Machines and Network
Experience with IaC (Terraform, Ansible) and monitoring and metric tools (Grafana, Prometheus)
Experience with SQL
Experience with configuration and provision management tools
Knowledge of Linux Administration
Knowledge of Automated Deployment and GIT source control
Understanding of Agile methodologies


Nice to have


Programming skills in Java or Python
Architecture in microservices with orchestration
Automated tests skills
Experience with ArgoCD


Company Benefits


1200€ to equip your home office
720€ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)


Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment


Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding


Want to know more? Get in touch with us 👇
Show more
HTML:
Volkswagen Digital Solutions is currently hiring a Site Reliability Engineer developer to join their amazing team

About The Company

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) they are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. They make sure that their products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Their main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management. 🚗

About The Role

You will be working in a DevOps Team and will be responsible for configuration, deployment, monitoring, and application availability.

In this role, you should be able to automate tasks, treat the infrastructure as code, and take corrective actions to solve operations issues. You should also have a mindset to continuously improve, be proactive and participative with the team ceremonies, be a team player and enjoy sharing knowledge.

You'll be focused in

  • Analyzing, testing and technically investigating all reported problems and outages;
  • Automate tasks;
  • Taking initiative and ownership of problems to solve them;
  • Managing, escalating, and controlling incidents with clients until closure;
  • Participating in the definition and analysis of requirements;
  • Collaborating with internal teams;
  • Automate infrastructure in the cloud;
  • Configuring and providing observability for the application;
  • Actively working in conjunction with the developer team to guide and help them;

To succeed, you'll need

  • Experience with Cloud Environments
  • Experience with Kubernetes, CI/CD, Virtual Machines and Network
  • Experience with IaC (Terraform, Ansible) and monitoring and metric tools (Grafana, Prometheus)
  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience with configuration and provision management tools
  • Knowledge of Linux Administration
  • Knowledge of Automated Deployment and GIT source control
  • Understanding of Agile methodologies

Nice to have

  • Programming skills in Java or Python
  • Architecture in microservices with orchestration
  • Automated tests skills
  • Experience with ArgoCD

Company Benefits

  • 1200€ to equip your home office
  • 720€ gross/year home allowance
  • Performance bonus
  • Health insurance extendable to your household
  • Wellbeing program extendable to your household
  • Life insurance
  • Pension fund
  • Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
  • Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
  • Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)

Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment

  • Flexible working hours
  • Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
  • Pet friendly environment
  • Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
  • Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding

Want to know more? Get in touch with us 👇

Title: Python Engineer
Description:
Software Engineering

If you enjoy working on a single project for an extended period, we have an exciting opportunity! Join our product development dedicated team, where you'll work on backend environment. You'll get to work with cutting-edge technologies. At Zühlke, you are where innovation happens!

Your Talent


You have a technical-related degree and/or equivalent professional qualification
You are communicative and have an open-minded personality
You are fluent in English (both written and oral)


Required Skills


At least 3 years of experience in Backend development with Python;
Working experience with Javascript;
Ability to apply architectural and design patterns with a focus on quality, readability and maintainability;
Experience in visualizing software architecture (e.g. UML, C4) and documenting relevant technical concepts and decisions;
Experience with automated testing frameworks;


Advantages


Working experience with AWS;
Willingness to lead a team of engineers;
Previous experience working in pairs and/or ensembles and with TDD;
Working experience with Contentful or other content management systems;
Experience with configuring and using CI/CD tools – e.g GitLab and Jenkins;
Working in an agile team, with a good understanding of the concepts, practical experience;


Your Role


Solving complex technical problems
Directly communicating with customers and guiding them towards success
Working closely with your local and remote colleagues in agile setup
Creating high-quality solutions while adapting to customer requirements
Being curious, open-minded, and standing by your ideas


What working at Zuhlke is all about?

You will get a chance to work in an international client-based environment along with the leading experts (50 % of our employees are seniors/consultants) in the industry. We are committed and looking for engineers who will help Zühlke bring ideas to life.

Some Of Our Benefits


Possibility to reduce working hours up to 32 hours/week
Option for condensed working week - you can condense your working hours and spread it across 4 working days
Hybrid workplace – work from home and our office in Porto
Time and money allocated for your upskilling
22 days of Annual Leave
3 Creative Days that you can choose to take these days off or cash them out
Flexi-time – organize your working hours according to your daily needs
Trusted sick leave up to 3 days of paid leave
We offer private Health Insurance for all employees. Spouses and children (up to 25 years old)
We’ll top-up your salary by 100% if you opt for the shared initial leave of 150 consecutive days
Top-notch equipment & working with cutting-edge technologies
Referral bonuses
Various social Zühlke events


And many more!

At Zühlke you will feel included.

We welcome people from all backgrounds, regardless of their gender, personality, national origin, race, religion, colour, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability. We communicate openly with each other, assess ourselves honestly and enjoy working a team. We work in a diverse and multicultural environment with people from all over the world.

Apply to learn more about this opportunity at Zühlke!

Even if you feel you don't meet all the requirements yet, we are still happy to get to know you, learn more about your ambitions and ideas. We look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Senior Python Developer
Description:
Altamira is a boutique IT company that delivers Digital and AI solutions to a wide range of international customers. Headquartered in Bratislava (Slovakia), we work primarily in the financial, pharma and retail sectors delivering mobile, web and platform solutions using an expansive technology portfolio.

Altamira service delivery teams currently span Slovakia, Ukraine, and the Middle East, and we have ambitions to expand our footprint to meet the growing demand across Europe and into our primary growth markets in the UK and the US.

As a fully remote company, we welcome talented individuals seeking hourly-based freelance opportunities

About the project:

Join a forward-thinking company with a robust European presence specializing in commodity trading and innovative energy solutions. We're embarking on a project to overhaul the global internal management system to meet growing business demands.

Key components include:


Data consolidation and processing
ETL implementation
Automated workflows and calculations
PowerBI reporting
Various permission levels


You'll collaborate with a team of 5 Engineers, 2 MQAs, a BA, and a PM under the guidance of an Architect.



Important Note: For this role, we are currently seeking candidates who are fluent in Ukrainian.

About you:

Experience with Python for a 5+ years
Strong knowledge of Python
Experience with Restful APIs, Selenium, Git, bash scripting 
Preferred: Familiarity with Docker, AWS ECS, and AWS Lambda functions
Upper-Intermediate level of English
Fluent/Native in Ukrainian language

Nice to have:

Knowledge of Application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines 
Experience with data-related libraries ex. Pandas, FastAPI
Ability to work with ETL and Data Lake

You will work with:

Understand the use cases and requirements of the stakeholders and provide technical solutions
Write effective, scalable Python code with proper unit tests, error handling, and logging
Test and debug programs and improve the functionality of existing systems 
Provide estimates and communicate project plan to stakeholders 
Continually look for process improvements and more efficient use of technology

Our transparent recruitment journey usually takes up to 2 weeks and includes a few stages:


Recruiting Interview -> 30-45 min
Technical Interview -> 1-1,5h
Client Interview (optional) -> up to 1h
Reference Check
Offer


If you're seeking a flexible, welcoming, and professional environment, join our freelance project-based team!

We do believe that the success of altamira.ai is impossible without the success of our Talents and the success of our Clients!

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
Description:
Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do


Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events


Who you are


You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an experienced Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software


About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack


Show more

Title: React Developer
HTML:
Fundada em 2005, em Lisboa, a agap2IT é uma organização europeia na área dos Sistemas de Informação, Ciência e Tecnologia. A capacidade de intervir globalmente aliada à elevada experiência e know-how técnico, funcional e de negócio da equipa, garantem a excelência da resposta aos mais exigentes desafios.

Com o espírito agapiano e valores como a valorização humana, empreendedorismo e responsabilidade social, mais do que um projeto, terás a oportunidade de criares uma carreira à tua medida.

Descrição do perfil:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou semelhante;
  • Experiência de 4+ anos com desenvolvimento ReactJS;
  • Experiência com Redux é valorizada;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens de Javascript e/ou Typescript;
  • Conhecimentos em Web Services e REST APIs;
  • Conhecimentos em ambientes Cloud (AWS ou Azure ou GCP) são valorizados;
  • Experiência em ambiente CI/CD;
  • Experiência em arquiteturas micro front-end é valorizada;
  • Conhecimentos na execução de testes unitários;
  • Experiência com metodologias Agile;
  • Domínio da língua inglesa.


Os nossos incentivos agapianos são:

  • Seguro de saúde;
  • Seguro de vida e acidentes pessoais;
  • Formações (técnicas, comportamentais e linguísticas) e certificações (técnicas) gratuitas;
  • Protocolo com plataforma de descontos em diferentes setores;
  • Plano Vodafone (comunicações e banda larga móvel);
  • Acesso a consultas de nutrição, psicologia e medicina geral gratuitas;
  • Acompanhamento de progressão de carreira contínuo e personalizado.


Na agap2IT defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas. Junta-te a nós!

Title: Python Developer (Databases)
Description:
We’re looking for a talented Python Developer (Databases) (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust APIs to join our innovative and diverse team. The ideal candidate will have a strong backend and databases experience to serve as a bridge between databases, data engineers, and APIs.




Your responsibilities

Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Utilize linters and other code quality tools to maintain high standards of code organization and cleanliness.
Work with data ensuring strong connection between databases, data engineers, and APIs.




Your profile

More than 3 years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, particularly FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Good understanding of web application backend development
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking




If you do not hear from us within 30 days from the date of your application, please consider your application unsuccessful. We thank you for your understanding.




WE OFFER:




Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, “workation” program, 24 vacation days plus paid Christmas week holiday.




Relocate easily

Start swiftly and smoothly with our relocation allowance and adaptation program.




ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it’s AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.




We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.




Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in both Munich, Germany and Porto, Portugal.




Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it’s AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.


We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.


Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in both Munich, Germany and Porto, Portugal.


Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

Title: Python developer (Hybel)
Description:
Visma is not just your average company – we're a leading Norwegian player in the mission-critical business software scene, making a real impact. Picture us as the folks who find, build, and deliver software that genuinely makes life better for millions of people worldwide.




Our software? It's the magic wand that simplifies and automates those tricky work processes, giving folks the freedom to enjoy their everyday lives a bit more. Now, here's the cool part – Visma isn't just a company; it's a dynamic network of go-getters, each running their show with that startup flair, unique personality, and strong leadership.




What sets us apart? Well, each of our companies gets to do its thing – we call it business autonomy. It's like a secret sauce that keeps our growth game strong. Our mission is simple but powerful: we want to empower people by making complex tasks easy. Looking forward, we're not just tech enthusiasts; we're on a mission to shape the future of society through our tech wizardry.




About Hybel

We are working on a Norwegian product that makes it super easy for everyone to run a business property leasing and rent payment. You are welcome for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace! We cherish a culture where empathy, diversity, respect and courage are front and center.




Tech stack:

HTML, CSS, Javascript
Python & Django
Postgres & Redis
RabbitMQ & Celery
Docker




What we expect from you:

You are an experienced developer with at least 3 to 5 years of experience building
successful online products & services
You possess a can-do attitude and desire to make your mark in scaling out an established service that thousands depend upon daily
You want to be part of a team where your education & experience counts for something, and where you can argue when pragmatism trumps perfection, and quickly see the impact of your contribution.
You are familiar with the typical developer tools and practices such as git, code reviews, testing/QA, etc, while also having 3 to 5 years of demonstrable experience with the technologies we use, specifically Python and Django.
You have a work permit for working in Portugal




What you bring to the table:

You have empathy for users and truly care about improving their experience
You are curious with a growth mindset and search for and enjoy finding ways to improve and learn
You like collaborating with team members as well as across team boundaries being a good communicator comfortable with spoken and written English
You know, care about and use sound engineering practices to develop well-crafted software
Deep understanding of all stages in software development lifecycle, software architectures and providing technical leadership. You are great with Python!

 

What you can expect from us:

In our nordic-inspired work environment, we appreciate flexibility, autonomy, and a collaborative spirit. If you're someone who enjoys getting hands-on, work/life balance, values learning and finds joy in sharing experiences with colleagues.. you're in the right place!

We love that you bring your ideas to the table: You will be part of a culture that favours experiments and value initiative, so it’s easy to get your ideas heard.
Make an impact from day 1: We want you to experience meaning as much as you experience mastery through creating value that impacts people's everyday lives. And you get to influence how to go about creating that value with full autonomy of your work.
Flexibility at all stages of life: Work is an important part of life. Yet, we know that you are much more than your job. We make room for people at all stages of life.
We invest in your competence: When you step into Visma, opportunities from A-Z awaits. You will be met by engaged leaders that care for and support you, and take part in competence sharing and learning networks across Visma within.
Above all, we are a team: Team spirit is key for us to deliver on our promises to people and society, but most importantly; to form a culture where people support and care for each other as much as we have tons of fun together

 

 

 

We celebrate a culture where everyone's uniqueness contributes to our collective success. Feel free to share a bit about yourself, your interests and what makes you thrive both at work and in life. We're looking forward to learning more about you!

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
📢 Our mission? Ivy Partners is a Swiss consulting firm contributing to the evolution of businesses in their strategic, technological, and organizational challenges.




Our goal today is to offer our collaborators a career that will contribute positively to their fulfillment and well-being, by enhancing their skills and offering them real prospects for evolution.







👩‍💻🧑‍💻 As an AI Software Engineer at Ivy Partners, your missions will be:




Advise and guide the team in designing modern and modular software architectures and frameworks for AI-powered and mostly web-based applications.
Take the lead on establishing best practices for software engineering and adopting the most suitable frameworks, tools and platforms for building successful AI applications.
Develop AI-powered software applications, which might include multiple components such as frontend, backend, databases, API integrations and monitoring.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and software engineers to ensure seamless integration of data pipelines, machine learning algorithms and software modules into successful AI-based applications.




🏅 About you!




Data Engineering: Advanced proficiency in data preparation, processing, and analysis.
Machine Learning: Confirmed experience in developing and deploying machine learning models.
Artificial Intelligence: Strong expertise in AI methodologies and technologies.
Software Architecture & Frameworks: Proven experience in designing scalable software architectures and working with relevant frameworks.
Financial Knowledge: Basic understanding of financial concepts such as derivatives, stocks, trading, and equities.
Education: A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field is preferred.
Experience: A minimum of 1 year of experience in AI, machine learning, or related roles.







🤝 IVY, it’s also:




Kindness | Concerned about our employees, we guarantee a favourable environment where everyone is valued and offered training and prospects for evolution in Switzerland or internationally.




Trust | Working with us means developing a partnership based on trust, professionalism, and transparency at every moment.




Innovation | We guarantee an effective digital transformation thanks to technological innovation coupled with creativity.




Responsibility | The collective is at the base of everything we undertake, and we take this responsibility seriously by striving to have a positive impact.

Title: Backend Python Developer
Description:
Job Description

Founded in 2015, BPCE Infogérance & Technologies is a subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, dedicated to Infrastructures, End-User Environment, Security and Production. Driven by growth, expertise, transformation and agility, this project embraces an international mindset and a diverse skill set. You’ll find yourself in a dynamic and enriching workplace or, as we like to name it, a real tech playground, where you’ll be able to explore a huge tech stack.

“The ROS team is a team of python developers on the IP-LABEL NEWTEST solution and on the EKARA target. The scenarios that are developed are used to monitor retail networks (Banque Populaire and Caisses d'Epargne, Palatine, etc.). The team works mainly for the MCO of scenarios and for 15% on new projects.

He must have relations with the business services of the BPCE group and the ROS team. He will have to intervene on regular production releases in support of the scenarios. It operates in agile mode.

Monitoring concerns all the departments of the group, multi-application, multi-direction.

Based on the expressions of needs provided to which he can contribute, the Development Engineer develops a Python supervision scenario in compliance with the desired developments, standards, quality and deadlines.

He will be able to create industrial python libraries used in all scenarios

The employee will need to coordinate and lead the junior developers in the team. He will also need to coordinate to the teams in France that are working on the Newtest Architecture, operating modes and the business lines.

Missions:


Develop according to current standards and design methods
Develop, test, assemble and release software components, write and update documentation
Ensure corrective maintenance and evolutionary maintenance.
On certain activities, it may be necessary to coordinate the actors concerned
He must be a good communicator to participate in coordination meetings between business teams, application production
Lead and coordinate the Junior developer on the activity
Coordinate the activity between France (Architecture & Business Lines) & Porto


Qualifications

Main requirements:


Knowledge of production tools such as Python, automated testing tools (NEWTEST Supervision),Windows powershell, batch msdos, Sqlserver query.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office office tools
Learn to know all the information systems of the group's entities


Other requirements:


On-call
Good level of English - minimum B2 level
French is a plus
Ability to keep up with a demanding and fast-paced environment;
Good communication skills;
Good priority definition skills;
Know how on implementing pedagogy methods;
Ability to work in a team.


Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant’s gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

Candidate’s Journey

Following your online application, you’ll be contacted by one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists. The next steps would be to meet our business experts (Team Leaders and Team Managers), welcome and onboard you into the Team.

Few other things you should know:

This career opportunity is based in Porto, right in the heart of the city, and offers a hybrid working model.

Last but not least, we invite you to discover what a day in your like could look like:

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

 Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.
Show more

Title: Python API Developer
Description:
We’re looking for a talented Python API Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust APIs to join our innovative and diverse team. In this role, you will create high-quality APIs that our UI team will utilize to bring their creative visions to life on our Design Studio platform. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences.




Your responsibilities

Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Utilize linters and other code quality tools to maintain high standards of code organization and cleanliness.




Your profile

More than 3 years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, particularly FastAPI, pydantic
Experience in asynchronous Python
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Good understanding of web application backend development
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking




If you do not hear from us within 30 days from the date of your application, please consider your application unsuccessful. We thank you for your understanding.




WE OFFER:




Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, “workation” program, 24 vacation days plus paid Christmas week holiday.




Relocate easily

Start swiftly and smoothly with our relocation allowance and adaptation program.




ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it’s AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.




We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.




Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in both Munich, Germany and Porto, Portugal.




Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

Title: Development Engineer
Description:
Allient Inc. is currently seeking a Development Engineer to join our team in Porto, Portugal!




Allient Inc. is a global publicly traded company in the motion control industry with over 2200 employees at 26 locations in 11 countries. Allient Inc. has an opportunity for a Development Engineer which will help develop and design electric motors, involving electromagnetic, mechanical, and thermal designs. Apply now!




Requirements:




Develop design studies for new and existing products, according to market and customer requirements.
Standardize key features in design and/or processes and incorporate them in the development.
Review detailed design drawing activities internally and with external suppliers.
Validate initial motor samples and/or product changes, through document management and execution of experimental tests.
Participate in analysis, cost development of the components and permanent cost reduction activities
Research and Development of product and process, in collaboration with the company's technological centers.




Qualifications:




Master’s degree in mechanical engineering or similar.
CAD/CAE (PTC Creo, Solidworks, Inventor, Ansys)
Ability to speak and write in English.




Don't let this opportunity pass you by - APPLY TODAY!




To learn more about Allient Inc. visit www.Allient.com




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to the individual's race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, age, disability, genetic information, status as a military veteran or any other characteristic protected by applicable law or legally protected status

Title: Python Developer (m/f)
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Professionals With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with Python development;
  • Previous experience with SQL and relational databases;
  • Experience in REST APIs and synchronous messaging;
  • Experience in Docker (from the developer's point of view);
  • Experience in Git;
  • Knowledge of microservices design patterns;
  • Knowledge of CI/CD;
  • Previous contact with unit, integration and end-to-end testing;
  • Organizational and communication skills;
  • Proactivity and dynamism;
  • Good English level.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

Join us in: Python Developer

Title: Associate Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Company: 7.1 Tech Hub - a ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE company
Description:
Introduction Sentence

As an Associate Data Scientist in our Tech Hub in Portugal, you will be at the forefront of innovation at our company and engage with stakeholders across various business units to integrate artificial intelligence as a pivotal support tool across our entire value chain, spanning from content processing to monetization. In this position, you will take on an important role within your Scrum team focusing on the development, adjustment, and monitoring of Machine Learning Models, as well as on the exploration of new developments in research and the market.

Sounds like an exciting and varied setup? Then become part of our team and drive cutting-edge solutions for the ProSiebenSat.1 Group.

What You Can Expect In This Role


As an Associate Data Scientist, you will work as part of a project team on the development of new machine learning applications for our internal colleagues
You will take responsibility and contribute your own ideas to ensure our applications use the best possible models, driving topics from feature engineering and algorithm selection to model monitoring/evaluation
You will work on our state-of-the-art AI / ML cloud platform with over 300GB of data processed daily and with frameworks like MetaFlow and MLflow on topics ranging from classical machine learning in big data environments to NLP and video mining
You will have the chance to perform advanced data analysis with SQL and Apache Spark on distributed systems and use the gained insights to enable data driven decision making
Teamwork and your development are always at the top of our agenda - you will work closely with our experienced team and receive the coaching you need to develop further


Your Essential Experience And Education


You have a university degree in data science, mathematics, statistics or in a comparable field with (very) good grades
You have already gained practical experience in data science and machine learning, NLP and/or Computer Vision would be a plus
Your Python skills are outstanding, as well as your theoretical and practical knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms
Ideally, you have experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure or GCP) and ML-Ops tools such as MetaFlow and MLflow
Enjoy working in an agile team setup while showcasing an exceptional willingness to learn
Fluent in English (Portuguese and/ or German language proficiency is a plus)


What's in it for you?


Become a part of a leading media company and help us to create real emotions among our viewers and customers
Join us in our transformation journey as we work to create a world-class technology hub
Benefit from 25 days of vacation per year, a great flexibility and the possibility of mobile working thanks to our hybrid working model
Enjoy an open and diverse company culture with flat hierarchies, as well as a modern and appreciative working environment and no formal dress code
Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities
Join our P7S1 employee networks and get engaged in a topic you are passionate about, e.g., PROUD, Greenteam, fempowerment, language buddies
More perks to come soon (e.g. professional development opportunities, fitness classes)


Closure

We are looking forward to your application!

Apply within 5 minutes via our job portal.

Your profile doesn't fit 100%? No worries, apply anyway! We support your professional & personal development on the job.

At Seven.One Tech Hub, part of ProSiebenSat.1 as the home of popular entertainment/infotainment and a leading entertainment and commerce player in the German-speaking region, we make digital entertainment happen! Reaching millions of viewers and users each day is the basis of our success. We develop first-class products and take our technology to the next level every single day. You are looking for an exciting career opportunity in media and e-com, love to work for different branches and products, and become part of a diverse tech community? Join our newly set-up Tech Hub and become a crucial part of our digital future.

Company Text

Click here to learn more about the ProSiebenSat.1 Group and our diverse portfolio.

As a signatory of the Diversity Charter, ProSiebenSat.1 is committed to a working environment free of prejudice and actively promotes diversity and equal opportunities among employees.

You have a disability and would like to apply? Then you are very welcome.

We know that we are not entirely accessible yet, but we are working on it. Let's talk about how we can eliminate any barrier together and find an individual solution if needed.

Although we refer to one gender in the text, all genders may be implied.

Title: AI Software Engineer (to help developing new AI tools)
Description:
🚀 Welcome to Next Engineering - Where Innovation Meets Purpose

Be the NEX T AI Software Engineer!

Context

Ensure the quality of the end-to-end lifecycle of our AI solutions. This includes everything from data preparation and model training to – POC and at scale – deployment, monitoring, and maintenance. This is in close collaboration with our AI Tech Lead and other team members, helping team to build and deliver AI-powered applications in a secure, efficient, and reliable manner. Such applications are designed to serve several use cases across distinct business areas

Delivery of an AI Tools to support business use cases that will be prioritized by the AI team, whether POCs or production grade.

Mission

Advise and guide the team in designing modern and modular software architectures and frameworks for AI-powered and mostly web-based applications.

Take the lead on establishing best practices for software engineering and adopting the most suitable frameworks, tools and platforms for building successful AI applications.

Develop AI-powered software applications, which might include multiple components such as frontend, backend, databases, API integrations and monitoring.

Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and software engineers to ensure seamless integration of data pipelines, machine learning algorithms and software modules into successful AI-based applications.

Skills

Data Engineering

Machine-Learning

Artificial Intelligence

Software Architecture and Framework

Knowledge on Financial concepts is a plus (derivatives, stocks, trading, equities...)

Your NEX T step is right here!

Share your CV to with REF NGO

Let's shape the future, together!
Show more

Title: Volkswagen Digital Solutions - Site Reliability Engineer
Description:
Volkswagen Digital Solutions is currently hiring a Site Reliability Engineer developer to join their amazing team

About The Company

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) they are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. They make sure that their products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Their main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management. 🚗

About The Role

You will be working in a DevOps Team and will be responsible for configuration, deployment, monitoring, and application availability.

In this role, you should be able to automate tasks, treat the infrastructure as code, and take corrective actions to solve operations issues. You should also have a mindset to continuously improve, be proactive and participative with the team ceremonies, be a team player and enjoy sharing knowledge.

You'll be focused in


Analyzing, testing and technically investigating all reported problems and outages;
Automate tasks;
Taking initiative and ownership of problems to solve them;
Managing, escalating, and controlling incidents with clients until closure;
Participating in the definition and analysis of requirements;
Collaborating with internal teams;
Automate infrastructure in the cloud;
Configuring and providing observability for the application;
Actively working in conjunction with the developer team to guide and help them;


To succeed, you'll need


Experience with Cloud Environments
Experience with Kubernetes, CI/CD, Virtual Machines and Network
Experience with IaC (Terraform, Ansible) and monitoring and metric tools (Grafana, Prometheus)
Experience with SQL
Experience with configuration and provision management tools
Knowledge of Linux Administration
Knowledge of Automated Deployment and GIT source control
Understanding of Agile methodologies


Nice to have


Programming skills in Java or Python
Architecture in microservices with orchestration
Automated tests skills
Experience with ArgoCD


Company Benefits


1200€ to equip your home office
720€ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)


Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment


Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding


Want to know more? Get in touch with us 👇
Show more

Title: Junior QA Developer
Description:
The adidas Digital Growth team develops digital campaigns and platforms to enhance consumer experiences across .com and mobile apps. The QA Automation Team within this organization ensures that all content is properly validated, addressing any issues and maintaining clear communication with stakeholders. In this role, you'll support the Content Management process by developing an Automated QA system to test functional and non-functional requirements, including visual standards, compatibility, and localization.

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?


Development and maintenance of automated Tests for the CMS throughput;
Process and system documentation
Execute automated tests and report the results
Identify, record, document, and track bugs for system health
Integrate automated tests into Continuous Integration/Continuous Development for seamless execution
Communicate effectively with stream team members regarding test progress, issues, and results for problem-solving and troubleshooting


WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


Written and spoken in English
Degree in Systems Information, IT, Engineering or related
Experience in a technical full-time role or internship
Experience with coding and scripting (OOP or scripted languages)


WHAT ARE WE OFFERING?


Competitive salary, benefits and valuable discounts on adidas products
Hybrid work policy and flexible working hours
Sport-friendly environment, great work-life balance, and flexibility
State-of-art office space and conditions
Opportunity to be part of the build and growth of a tech hub on the biggest sports brand in the world


Candidates must be currently located in Portugal and already be eligible to take on full-time employment. Only applications with an English CV will be considered.
Show more

Title: Python Engineer
Description:
Software Engineering

If you enjoy working on a single project for an extended period, we have an exciting opportunity! Join our product development dedicated team, where you'll work on backend environment. You'll get to work with cutting-edge technologies. At Zühlke, you are where innovation happens!

Your Talent


You have a technical-related degree and/or equivalent professional qualification
You are communicative and have an open-minded personality
You are fluent in English (both written and oral)


Required Skills


At least 3 years of experience in Backend development with Python;
Working experience with Javascript;
Ability to apply architectural and design patterns with a focus on quality, readability and maintainability;
Experience in visualizing software architecture (e.g. UML, C4) and documenting relevant technical concepts and decisions;
Experience with automated testing frameworks;


Advantages


Working experience with AWS;
Willingness to lead a team of engineers;
Previous experience working in pairs and/or ensembles and with TDD;
Working experience with Contentful or other content management systems;
Experience with configuring and using CI/CD tools – e.g GitLab and Jenkins;
Working in an agile team, with a good understanding of the concepts, practical experience;


Your Role


Solving complex technical problems
Directly communicating with customers and guiding them towards success
Working closely with your local and remote colleagues in agile setup
Creating high-quality solutions while adapting to customer requirements
Being curious, open-minded, and standing by your ideas


What working at Zuhlke is all about?

You will get a chance to work in an international client-based environment along with the leading experts (50 % of our employees are seniors/consultants) in the industry. We are committed and looking for engineers who will help Zühlke bring ideas to life.

Some Of Our Benefits


Possibility to reduce working hours up to 32 hours/week
Option for condensed working week - you can condense your working hours and spread it across 4 working days
Hybrid workplace – work from home and our office in Porto
Time and money allocated for your upskilling
22 days of Annual Leave
3 Creative Days that you can choose to take these days off or cash them out
Flexi-time – organize your working hours according to your daily needs
Trusted sick leave up to 3 days of paid leave
We offer private Health Insurance for all employees. Spouses and children (up to 25 years old)
We’ll top-up your salary by 100% if you opt for the shared initial leave of 150 consecutive days
Top-notch equipment & working with cutting-edge technologies
Referral bonuses
Various social Zühlke events


And many more!

At Zühlke you will feel included.

We welcome people from all backgrounds, regardless of their gender, personality, national origin, race, religion, colour, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability. We communicate openly with each other, assess ourselves honestly and enjoy working a team. We work in a diverse and multicultural environment with people from all over the world.

Apply to learn more about this opportunity at Zühlke!

Even if you feel you don't meet all the requirements yet, we are still happy to get to know you, learn more about your ambitions and ideas. We look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Frontend Developer
Description:
Prime IT is a 100% Portuguese company specializing in the IT and Telecommunications sector. We collaborate with the best national and international talent, ensuring the most suitable solutions for the projects we undertake.

With over 2400 collaborators engaged in national and international projects, our teams specialize in Consulting, Nearshore, Project Management, and Closed Projects. Our success is a reflection of the results we achieve on a daily basis.




We believe that the path to success involves doing what makes us happy.

LISBON | PORTO | MADRID | BARCELONA | PARIS | LYON | NANTES | LILLE | AIX-EN-PROVENCE | BORDEAUX | GRENOBLE | GENÈVE | KATOWICE | WARSZAWA | LONDON | MILAN | SÃO PAULO

Career guidance and progression
